DataElement.preferredName: Mucosa Gingiva Oral Cavity Physical Examination Abnormal Finding Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify the not normal assessment of the moist tissue that lines the oral cavity and  the soft tissue surrounding the neck of individual teeth as well as covering the alveolar bone.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Mucosa Gingiva Oral Cavity Physical Examination Abnormal Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to not normal assessment of the moist tissue that lines the oral cavity and  the soft tissue surrounding the neck of individual teeth as well as covering the alveolar bone.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Mucosa Gingiva Oral Cavity Physical Examination
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The moist tissue that lines some organs and body cavities (such as the nose, mouth, lungs) and makes mucus (a thick, slippery fluid).:The mucous membrane-covered tissue of the jaws that surrounds the bases of the teeth.:The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: The soft tissue surrounding the neck of individual teeth as well as covering the alveolar bone. The tissue is fibrous and continuous with the periodontal ligament and mucosal covering.
The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

Property.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
